articles.title: Whale Freed After Rescue Effort Off the Big Island
articles.description: Just after first light Monday morning, calm waters off Honokohau Harbor set the scene for what would become a remarkable story of survival along the Kona coast.

articles.title: The Complex Logistics of Moving 30 Beluga Whales
articles.description: When 30 beluga whales and four dolphins are moved from Canada's Marineland amusement park, the operation will be both a careful logistical feat and what former trainers say is a long overdue move.

articles.title: Entangled Right Whale Known for Cape Cod Canal Closure Dies
articles.description: Rescue teams up and down the East Coast worked for months to try to rescue this whale. Researchers say deaths can be reduced by adopting ropeless fishing gear.

articles.title: Boat Strikes Threaten Long Island Whales
articles.description: The top two threats facing whales off Long Island's coast are boat strikes and fishing nets, according to research by the Atlantic Marine Conservation Society.

articles.title: Canada's Marineland Whales Could Find New Homes in U.S.
articles.description: Canada's last captive whales have received a reprieve from death after the government conditionally approved a plan to export them to the United States.

articles.title: Oregon Implements New Rules for Crab Fishers to Reduce Whale Deaths
articles.description: The Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife is implementing temporary rule changes for Dungeness crab fishers to restrict gear and areas where fishing can occur.

articles.title: Greenland Declares Emergency After Orcas Spotted Near Melting Ice Shelves
articles.description: Researchers have spotted orcas breaching dangerously close to rapidly melting ice shelves, prompting emergency measures in Greenland.

articles.title: A North Atlantic Right Whale Baby Boom Is On, But the Species Remains at Risk
articles.description: Researchers have documented nearly two dozen North Atlantic right whale calves this season. It's an encouraging sign for a species whose population is below 400.

articles.title: Aquariums Save Beluga Whales from Threat of Euthanasia
articles.description: Several aquariums have stepped in to rescue beluga whales that were facing potential euthanasia, providing them new homes and care.

articles.title: 44-Year-Old Whale 'Slalom' Breaks Record with Seventh Calf
articles.description: A 44-year-old whale nicknamed 'Slalom' has given birth to her seventh calf, breaking a 15-year record for the species.
